elements.title: Vientiane railway station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Vientiane railway station (pictured) in Laos is the largest on the Boten–Vientiane railway and can accommodate 2,500 passengers, but currently only serves three trains per day?

elements.title: John Kennedy of Dingwall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that John Kennedy of Dingwall was minister of the same church for forty years?

elements.title: the Los Angeles (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jim Londos was one of four wrestlers recognized by The Ring as professional wrestling's "true world champion", for holding both the Los Angeles and New York versions of the world title?

elements.title: Rusli Zainal (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rusli Zainal, the former governor of Riau, represented the province in the Indonesia International Quran Competition as a child?

elements.title: Poison Ivy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the writer of the 2022 comic book miniseries Poison Ivy, starring the eponymous Batman villain, described it as a "love story" that features "plant-based body horror"?

elements.title: François Léon Jouinot-Gambetta (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1917 French general François Léon Jouinot-Gambetta led an offensive that advanced 57 miles (92 km) in six days to capture Skopje?

elements.title: Sundrum Castle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the fall of Sundrum Castle was alluded to in a poem by Robert Chambers in the 19th century and was later referred to as a curse?

elements.title: Atari Word Processor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that one reviewer called deleting a block of text in Atari Word Processor "as easy as a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h,i,j,k,l"?
